alert.note: Alert for Central Gunnison and Uncompahgre River Basin; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys; West Elk and Sawatch Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 4:18PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Pitkin and northwestern Gunnison Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 417 PM MDT, meteorologists and satellite imagery were tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles east of Paonia, or 32 miles northwest of Gunnison, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Satellite. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Marble around 435 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Mount Crested Butte. This includes Colorado 133 between mile markers 16 and 32, and between mile markers 45 and 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Gunnison and Uncompahgre River Basin; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys; West Elk and Sawatch Mountains
